widget.tooltip: Enter the message to show users when they reach your website.
widget.help: This message is shown before the More Info link (see below). In most cases it is just one sentence saying that this website makes use of cookies.

widget.tooltip: Enter the label of a link users can click to read more about your cookie policy.
widget.help: This label is often set to More Info or Learn More or Our Cookie Policy. Whatever is best adapted to your website.

widget.tooltip: Enter the URL where users can read more about your cookie policy.
widget.help: In most cases this is a link to your terms and conditions page. If you have a specific paragraph about cookies, you may want to add an anchor (...#cookies) at the end of your URL. You may also have a specific page to explain about cookies.
widget.background-value: link to your cookie policy page

widget.tooltip: Enter the label to show in the dimiss button.
widget.help: The popup includes a dismiss button that can be clicked to dismiss the popup (which generally means the user consents to the cookie policy). The label can be changed using this edit box. A usual label here is OK or Got it! or Dimiss.

widget.tooltip: Enter domain to use with the Cookie Consent cookie.
widget.help: Cookie consent saves its information in a cookie. By default, the cookie makes use of the current domain and sub-domain. This can be a problem if you allow access to your website with subdomain names such as w, ww, www and wwww without redirecting the user. In that case, you probably want to enter your domain name without any sub-domain. (i.e. "example.com" instead of "www.example.com")

widget.tooltip: Enter the number of days the cookie of the Cookie Consent script is saved for.
widget.help: By default the consent on the cookie is set to 1 year (365 days.) You may reduce that number. The HTTP/1.1 protocol forbids us to use a larger duration. Although we accept durations as small as 1 day, it is probably wise to use at least 7 (consent once a week) or even 30 (consent about once a month).

widget.tooltip: Select the theme you want to use with your website.
widget.help: The theme determines how the popup looks like and where it appears. It also includes some default information on how the popup animates.
